title: Periodic Table of Mobility: A policy guidance tool by NUMO

description.part2: Switch language between English and Spanish using buttons above.

resultPage.part2: Please choose from the drop-down menu at the bottom

document.introPDF: This document is a summary of the NUMO policy recommendation for a VEHICLENAME in a USECASE, based on the Periodic Table of Mobility. It can be used in Atlantis to process requirements in order to use this vehicle in this glorious (albeit fictitious) island.
document.driversReq: A driver license is required for this vehicle, more information to request a license can be found HERE
document.driversNotReq: A driver license is not required to operate this vehicle. Regardless, please be careful when moving around our city and follow all traffic rules. See HERE the general traffic rules for your beautiful island.
document.operatingReq: An operating license is required for this vehicle, more information can be found HERE
document.operatingNotReq: An operating license is not required to operate this vehicle. However, please remember to stay safe. It's a jungle out there.
document.dataStrict: This vehicle in the use case indicated has the highest level of data requirements, according to the Atlantis Data Office's guidelines available HERE. Given the characteristics of the vehicle and how it will be used, these more stringent requirements have been established for everyone's wellbeing, and in order to monitor with greater detail how the vehicle is being used. You have been warned
document.dataLoose: This vehicle must report some data, according to the Atlantis Data Office's moderate level guidelines available HERE. And remember that we will always protect your privacy
document.dataNone: No data will be required of this vehicle, You can roam freely and peacefully but please always be alert of your surroundings. Also, you could still voluntarily provide some data it if you find that it will improve Atlantis's mobility conditions. If you are interested in providing data, please go HERE (you can later revoke this).
document.pricesLow: Fees associated to this vehicle will be low, according to the very popular and well-respected Pricing Office of Atlantis. Please see guidelines HERE
document.pricesHigh: Fees associated to this vehicle will be high, according to the very popular and well-respected Pricing Office of Atlantis. Please see guidelines HERE
document.pricesNA: There are no fees associated to this vehicle, according to the very popular and well-respected Pricing Office of Atlantis. You must be using a nice, slow, light vehicle. We love it.
document.subsidyGiven: This vehicle can receive a subsidy, after a very simple process that can be requested online through the Department of Nice Things HERE. It's our way of saying thanks.
document.subsidyNone: This vehicle is not eligible to receive subsidies. Are you sure you want to use it? Wouldn't you rather use another vehicle with better conditions? There's lots to choose from, remember we're a magical place so the sky's the limit
document.riskReq: A risk assessment is required for this vehicle. The Risk Department contains greater details here
document.riskNotReq: Risk assessment is required for this vehicle. We like it and hope you have a great time, though please remember to follow all traffic rules.

inputPanel.part2: Please choose from the drop-down menu at the bottom or input specific vehicle attributes.

inputHelp.noDescription: No information is available for this attribute.
inputHelp.noteText: The thresholds used for this attribute are based on literature and expert feedback collected by NUMO. A future version of this platform will include the ability to adjust these thresholds.

summary.harmfulSum: This vehicle may be very harmful
summary.harmful: Policies should be aimed at reducing its overall risk. Consider allocating less space for them while giving preference to others, requiring more data from operators, requiring a license to operate, or charging high fees to operate.
summary.lessHarmful: Policies should be aimed at reducing its overall risk. Consider allocating less space for them, requesting some data from operators, or charging some fees to operate.
summary.notHarmfulSum: This vehicle is not likely to be harmful
summary.notHarmful: Policies should be aimed at promoting its use. Consider allocating more space to them, don’t request too much data from operators, don’t require a license to operate, and consider subsidizing their usage.

city.title: Please describe your social and policy priorities
city.subtitle: Learning about social and policy goals and priorities of a city is helpful to provide well-adjusted recommendations on transport policies
city.defgoals: Define your own goals and priorities (below)
city.placeholder1: Name for new list of priorities
city.placeholder2: Describe the priorities of your city according to the main policies you have at the national, local level and specific policies for transportation.
city.part1: Please rank the priorities for improvement according to current city policies (a higher number represents a higher priority):

attributes.part1: Please indicate what attributes you will use to define vehicles
attributes.part2: The attributes selected (with capacity, weight, speed, footprint, emissions and health being the default) will determine what attributes are required for your city

thresholds.name: Input city name
thresholds.title: Please determine the threshold levels for
thresholds.subtitle: Thresholds below determine the price indication for use of a vehicle in your city

header.title: Periodic Table of Mobility
header.subtitle: A policy guidance tool by NUMO
header.part1: This platform helps provide recommendations for policy based on the depending on the attributes and use cases of specific vehicles (existing or hypothetical). There are pre-loaded values that you can choose to learn the policy implications of existing vehicles. You can add customized characteristics, or create new vehicle types as well.
header.link: Learn why this tool exists and how to offer feedback.
